The property is a 5-minute walk from one of the major attractions in Hannibal--Rockcliffe Mansion. The Mark Twain Boyhood Home & Museum, the Mark Twain Memorial Lighthouse, the historic Hannibal downtown, etc., etc. are all exactly a mile away--easily walkable even with little kids.

review_text:
After reading all the glowing reviews, I wondered why no one complained about anything. Well, now I know. There is nothing to complain about! The Guesthouse is spacious, clean, comfortable, and well appointed.
There are three doors that open onto the deck. I never tired of looking at the river. Sunsets are amazing ... so are sun rises! We ate every meal on the deck. I had my morning coffee there as well as my evening wine. Sitting there was so peaceful and soul nurturing. I really didn't want to leave.
Both our dog and cat were welcomed. Plenty of room for the dog to run outdoors (but no fenced enclosure) and the cat hung out happily in the deck's sunshine.
Tourist attractions are just a few minutes away by car, as were a couple of well stocked grocery stores. Plenty of fresh fruits and vegetables as well as some good salmon that we grilled on the convenient gas grill located just off the deck.
Hosts were friendly and helpful. Communication was clear and easy.
Only one recommendation to future visitors: Use the insect repellant so generously provided by the hosts prior to exploring the grounds. I didn't notice anything so didn't use it. I ended up with LOTS of Chigger Bites. I mean LOTS! They are microscopic mites that hang out in the grass. Lesson learned by this former Midwesterner. Should have known better!
This rental is perfect for a solitary retreat, for couples, and for families. It is a GREAT value.
You will need to carry bags, etc. up a flight of stairs. Not a good place if you can't climb stairs.
Plenty of parking, and everything felt very safe. It's a secluded setting but just off the highway so totally convenient. (There is highway noise and an occasional train. So not super quiet on the deck. Indoors. however, was quiet, and we slept very well.)
One of the best places I've stayed. Highly recommend.
